Let’s change the world one code at a time

Girls Coding Kosova purpose is to encourage women to reach full academic and professional potential in technical fields.

Get In Touch

Social Impact

In order promote a multidisciplinary approach to problem-solving, selected GCK members will serve as tech ambassadors disseminating concepts of how citizens involved in different sectors can benefit from and contribute to technology for social good.

Coding Skills

Girls Coding Kosova is constantly working on bringing events to young enthusiastic girls of Kosovo in order to encourage and support them in coding, launching of own entrepreneurial initiatives, or working as developers in other exciting start-ups in the country.

Entrepreneurship

Considering the importance of technology and the current state-of-affairs in Kosovo, our aim is to work towards changing the current situation in a way that enables young women to develop high-value skills and gain a sense of empowerment in Kosovo’s challenging labour market environment.

About

Our vision is to create a free-of-gender-bias IT sector in Kosovo and the Balkans by working in four (4) main areas:

Workshops

Projects

Job Creation

Network



See more

Our Latest Activities

Our programme ensures that the participation of young women beneficiaries is not limited to that of passive attendance: they will have an active role in designing, implementing, and leading end-product dissemination activities.

Some Facts

To this date, GCK has implemented numerous projects focused on designing and delivering intensive digital capacity-building workshops that teach women how to design, develop, and deploy professional and scalable real-world software solutions to issues related to good governance.

About Us

What started as a grassroots movement in 2014 has turned into an official NGO in 2015. In this short period of time, Girls Coding Kosova has managed to organize and implement fifty-nine (59) different activities such as meet-ups, workshops, boot camps, trainings, and presentations that have engaged a total of 3,751 participants. In 2016, GCK was awarded the FIDES Award and in 2017 the Albanian Woman in ICT Award.
